dialog: By Merlin's beard, I shall take them. Please package them and provide me with the parchment.
A wise decision, sir. An excellent choice.
Room service, I say!
Good morning, 'tis room 113 speaking. I require breakfast, pronto.
Very good, Mrs. Jones?
That is correct.
How can I be of assistance?
I would like a goblet of grapefruit juice, a jar of marmalade, a plate of scrambled eggs and sausages, a loaf of toast, and a cauldron of black coffee, if you please. How long until it arrives?
Only a matter of moments, madam.
Marvelous, I am grateful.
Greetings, Sam. I seek to purchase a companion. Have you any suggestions?
Rachel's pet emporium is where you should go.
And why is that, pray tell?
It's beyond special. One may find any manner of creature they can think to name, and more.
Is that so? Are there serpents within?
Serpents? Ha! There are even rodents and primates! A world of exotic creatures to choose from.
Fantastic, I cannot wait to visit.
Wait, are you certain that you wish to keep a non-traditional companion?
Why not? 'Tis quite cool.
But it may pose a hazard to your health, friend.
